title:
Upgrade the embedded ESE version to the latest on
...

messages.content:
Upgrade the embedded ESE version to the latest on
Windows

Upgrading the Embedded ESE Version to the Latest on Windows
============================================================

The embedded ESE version can be upgraded to the latest on Windows. Here's a step-by-step guide:

**Confirming ESE Listening on Port 9443**
--------------------------------------

1. To confirm if ESE is listening on port 9443, type the following command:
   ```
   SuSE: netstat -ntlp | grep 9443
   RHEL: lsof -i -P -n | grep 9443
   ```

**Upgrading Embedded ESE Version**
---------------------------------

1. After upgrading ESE, on the SRM Admin UI page, go to CONFIG > Settings > Dell Technologies Connectivity and click Test Server Connectivity icon.
2. **Generate New Access Key/ PIN**: 
    a. Generate new AccessKey/PIN at Dell Product Support.
3. **Enter New Access Key/PIN**:
    b. Enter the generated AccessKey/PIN and click Save.
4. **Verify Connection to Dell Server**: On the SRM Admin UI page, go to CONFIG > Settings > Dell Technologies Connectivity and click Test Server Connectivity icon to verify that connection to Dell server is successful.

**Confirming ESE Version**
-------------------------

1. After successful connection, to confirm the version of ESE installed, use the following command:
   ```
   curl -k -H $'x-dell-auth-key: Afor!@#akhdqwihqiu34344\_y9yfqiwiwuefi56w3AABweuf' https://localhost:9443/ese/status
   ```

By following these steps, you can upgrade the embedded ESE version to the latest on Windows.

messages.content:
Upgrade to SRM 5.1.1.0 using the new update
platform

**Direct Search Results for: 'Upgrade to SRM 5.1.1.0 using the new update
platform'**

**Result 1:**
- **Title:** You can upgrade to Dell SRM 5.1.1.0 by using the new update platform or system upgrade wizard.
- **Document:** SRM_Upgrade_Guide
- **Page:** 1
- **Relevance Score:** 1.622
- **Search Type:** font_based_heading
- **Content:**
## You can upgrade to Dell SRM 5.1.1.0 by using the new update platform or system upgrade wizard.
*Chapter: On Additional Backends, provide 'apg1', apg2', 'apg3' and 'apg4' details:*
*Page: 1*



---

**Result 2:**
- **Title:** You can upgrade to Dell SRM 5.1.1.0 by using the new update platform or system upgrade wizard.
- **Document:** SRM_Upgrade_Guide
- **Page:** 1
- **Relevance Score:** 1.553
- **Search Type:** semantic
- **Content:**
## You can upgrade to Dell SRM 5.1.1.0 by using the new update platform or system upgrade wizard.
*Chapter: On Additional Backends, provide 'apg1', apg2', 'apg3' and 'apg4' details:*
*Page: 1*



---

**Result 3:**
- **Title:** 2. Copy the cacerts file to a safe place. (Do not use the Java installation directory as the new installation deletes and replaces it .)
- **Document:** SRM_Upgrade_Guide
- **Page:** 8
- **Relevance Score:** 1.539
- **Search Type:** font_based_heading
- **Content:**
# 2. Copy the cacerts file to a safe place. (Do not use the Java installation directory as the new installation deletes and replaces it .)










1. Check to see if there are any certificate files at <APG\_HOME>/Java/Sun-JRE/<version>/customcerts . If there are any certificates, your certificates will be automatically migrated during the update, and you can skip the next step.
2. If there are no certificate files at <APG\_HOME>/Java/Sun-JRE/<version>/customcerts , then any certificates you previously added manually will not persist across the upgrade to SRM 5.1.1.0 You should perform a one-time reimport of the certificates file as described in the Importing custom certificates into the JRE section of the Dell M&R Security Configuration Guide at Dell Support Site.





<!-- image -->

- NOTE: If the customization to the alert definitions is done using only threshold values, then back-up of alert definitions is not required as threshold values are retained after upgrade.

Copying the alert definitions does not copy the alerting contexts. To add alerting context, right-click the wanted alert definition in the table and select Configure Options.




## Sections in this chapter:
- Import Java Certificates
- Backup Alert Definitions


---

**Result 4:**
- **Title:** 7. See the following steps only if you are upgrading from ViPR SRM 4.0 to ViPR SRM 4.1.1:
- **Document:** SRM_Upgrade_Guide
- **Page:** 17
- **Relevance Score:** 1.498
- **Search Type:** font_based_heading
- **Content:**
# 7. See the following steps only if you are upgrading from ViPR SRM 4.0 to ViPR SRM 4.1.1:






This procedure is required only if the SNMP Discovery is still being used and the SAN has not been migrated to the new Cisco and/or Brocade SolutionPacks. SAN discovery stops if this step is not completed when using the SNMP Discovery.



1. Log in to the device discovery web interface at https://<Frontend IP address>:58443/device-discovery . (On the Administration Dashboard, Device Discovery has been renamed SNMP Device Discovery.)

## Sections in this chapter:
- - a. From Dell SRM, go to Administration > SolutionPacks > Storage > Dell Data Protection Advisor .
- Update the SNMP Collections


---

**Result 5:**
- **Title:** 13. Log in to Dell SRM and confirm that the new Additional Backend is in the UI.
- **Document:** SRM_Installation_and_Configuration_Guide
- **Page:** 21
- **Relevance Score:** 1.456
- **Search Type:** font_based_heading
- **Content:**
# 13. Log in to Dell SRM and confirm that the new Additional Backend is in the UI.




The Additional Backend hosts are added to the existing Dell SRM configuration. To see the five servers that you have configured, browse to Administration, under SRM Admin UI click System admin > Servers& Modules > Servers .



This process completes the configurations for adding Collector hosts to the existing Dell SRM environment using the SRMConf-Tools. Collector software can be installed on a Linux or Windows platform. (Currently the Hyper-V SolutionPack requires a Windows platform.)








- Minimum System Requirements:

---
